title: The end result of rank reset every season
body:
I will start this off brief and as precise as I can.

Every year the rank reset brings every single player right back from their current ranking to a much lower one.

Riot tells us that our rank accurately tells us exactly how well we play as a whole relative to the rest of the server, I will not go into detail about this aspect in partiulcar.

The end result is a player who is in challenger might end up somewhere in high plat. I personally as a gold 5 player, ended up in bronze 1.

The whole purpose of a rank is to see how you compare to the rest of the players in the server. So why are rankings being manipulated every year.

There is no logical reasoning behind why rankings are manipulated each year. So I would ask for some kind of information to shed some light on a logical reason behind this.

replies.body:
Found this for you

Every season introduces lots of changes to various parts of League of Legends game play. Because of this we perform a soft reset on ranked standings. This means that though your previous season's performance carries weight, along with your placement matches, in most cases you can expect to be seeded lower than where you ended the previous season.

Keep in mind that even if you didn't place in the tier or division you expected, it's important to remember that this is your starting point for the season and not your final destination.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ

A player does not lose half of their capability through one big patch.

Even through an entire game overhaul a player would not lose half of their capability. This is in no way, justification for setting everyone back.

Every players rank is comparative to every other players rank, there is still no reason for setting everyone back if you are promoting the ranking system as accurate. Everyone should maintain their current position because relatively they are all still theoretically where they should be. Changing the game will simply make players have to adjust to it and drop a bit in rank if they poorly adjust, or rise in rank if they adjust better than others.

We do the reset at the start of each season partially because we use season changes to make big changes to the game, and we want to allow players a chance to prove themselves on the new version of Summoner's Rift. We don't do a full reset because we recognize that player skill isn't fully reset when the patch changes, but we do want to level the playing field a bit in order to give everyone a chance to rise to the top.

That also leads into another reason we do a reset at the start of each season: it should feel like players who end the season in a given rank earned their way there. If we fully carried over previous season's ranks, you wouldn't have to work as hard to maintain your rank as someone trying to get there for the first time. With new players, new patches, and new champions, the competitive landscape is always changing, and giving someone a huge head start due to past success wouldn't be fair. Similarly, someone who possibly earned a low rank while learning the game might have improved, and the ranked reset gives them a chance to start from a more even playing field.

Which is why we do the resets the way we do, which maintains the relative ordering of players, but basically closes the gap between everyone. Due to some mixups on our end, some of the resets this preseason have felt particularly onerous, but the general reasoning behind the reset remains the same.

Hope that helps =D

Once again ranks are meant to be relative to every other players rank on the server, by reducing everyones rank you are essentially manipulating players rank according to your own opinion which as I am to understand it, is something that is strictly forbidden to do.

Players are meant to end up in their true rank over time according to Riot, there is absolutely no justification for removing progress that was earned within each season, unless the game was literally changed from a MOBA into a First person shooter or RTS game like warcraft 3. Changes of information that Riot literally hands out to the public for viewing does not justify manipulation of the rankings. If players do not read the patch notes they will be the ones who drop in rank as their lack of the new game knowledge will cause them to fail more often, those who did read the patch notes will be just as prepared as they were previously.

There is nothing more demoralizing that losing what you have worked stupidly hard to achieve, EVERY SINGLE SEASON.

to put it in a more direct way, the rank reset gives players more incentive to play ranked since they want to climb to the rank they were before the reset or higher and it gives hope to those stuck in the bottom of bronze mmr. It also makes being boosted and staying boosted harder, meaning that rank you worked so hard to achieve means more.

I’ve always thought that the soft ranked reset had three main purposes.

1. To ensure you actually deserved the rank you ended up on and it wasn’t the result of boosting or one of your main champions being overtuned that season. If you belong at gold and get reset into bronze and silver you will climb back up. Ranked play is a process just because your earned Gold last season does not mean you earned the right to stay there permanently.

2. To partially re-set MMR based on how you performed. So if you’re winning a ton of games but not gaining ground because of your MMR the season reset would partially help with that.

3. To ensure the ranks don’t stagnate and new players have a chance. If everyone stayed at their current ranks they would have a massive advantage over players just starting. One that would be very difficult to overcome, even now you have an advantage as it’s a soft reset not a hard one. Not to mention the bag log of players you’d get sitting in the 5th division of every rank surviving on the minimum number of games required to avoid being demoted by decay.

All in all the soft reset helps the health of the game. It ensures that you earn your rank each season instead of just inheriting it. For the last three season’s I’ve been placed in bronze 3 and climbed to bronze 1 or 2. Then I usually get deterred by how much of a hard slog ranked is and how much the games tend to take out of me (Normals are just so much more relaxing). Just because I made it to Bronze 1 once doesn’t mean I deserve to sit there forever. And if I manage to start climbing (fingers crossed) I’ll need to prove I earned that rank.
